creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
There is a thread saftey problem with the rewrite cache on Win32, 
OS2 and Netware platforms using threaded 1.3 architectures.

The Mutex introduced in Apache 2.0's v. 1.83, could be backported.

http://cvs.apache.org/viewcvs/httpd-2.0/modules/mappers/mod_rewrite.c.diff?r1=1.82&r2=1.83&diff_format=h

We will always entertain applying a bugfix that is well thought out.

Not so easily, because there's no APR in 1.3.

Leave it ASSIGNED for now until someone has a stronger opinion about the point.

Thanks for using Apache.
creator: nd@perlig.de
wrowe@apache.org
text:
I believe we can safely mark this as WONTFIX (or LATER) as this version is kaput
for threaded platforms with no interest in solving.
